messages: 550bb4c9a840c14f94d758971d068100 (16:43): hi, if I develop a gpl app using qtopia on greenphone, have I to pay a qtopia license?

e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (16:45): the greenphone is i assume just hardware that you buy, it's qtopia's license that matters
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (16:45): unless you buy the gpl version of the phone
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (16:45): ask tt sales

bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:04): I have a problem, when I compile my application with Qt4.1.4, the application resides in memory and doesn't shutdown unless I use the end process from tha task manager. Does anyone have a solution to this??
bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:04): it used to work fine with qt 4.1.1
cea7f9481ddc3847e246edf46eb3cd05 (17:06): Mnabil_smartlabz: how does your main look. Do you run app.exec()?
bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:11): e8johan: the main returns app.exec()
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:11): !pastebin
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (17:11): chakie_work: [pastebin] http://qtnode.net/pastebin - a place to paste your Qt code to share with others
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:11): that's where main() should have been found ages ago :)

bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:12): I have a problem, when I compile my application with Qt4.1.4, the application resides in memory and doesn't shutdown unless I use the end process from tha task manager. Does anyone have a solution to this??  it used to work fine with qt 4.1.1

92a5653ef0a74265fb40402cdc70d697 (17:14): Hello! Please help: I have installed Qt-4.1.4 on windows and it compiled fine with all the examples. However when I try to compile my program compiler tryes to link to -lQtCore, but it should be -lQtCore4 and thus does not find it
92a5653ef0a74265fb40402cdc70d697 (17:15): Is there something I forgot to do?
92a5653ef0a74265fb40402cdc70d697 (17:18): Opps. sorry, now it compiled fine - I used visual c++ command prompt instead of normal one :)
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (17:18): 'Mnabil' pasted "qt error": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1259
859620093d0762d05b35bb8fb2d9dcb7 (17:19): i'm trying to build qt on ma machine and it gives these error http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1259
859620093d0762d05b35bb8fb2d9dcb7 (17:20): i'm using kubuntu
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:20): Mnabil_smartlabz: uh, what does that paste have to do with the not exiting app?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:21): Mnabil_smartlabz: instead of repeating the question, could you please just pastebin your main()?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:21): park: you need the x11 development packages
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:22): park: i think this package could be enough: libx11-dev
cea7f9481ddc3847e246edf46eb3cd05 (17:23): park: you might want the xshape support aswell
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:24): i guess there's a reason why the ubuntu:s leave out all development packages
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (17:26): 'Mnabil_smartlabz' pasted "app resides - Qt4.1.4": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1260
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:29): Mnabil_smartlabz: you use threads?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:29): it will hang unless all threads have exited
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:30): i think
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:30): it just sits and waits for the threads to be finished
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:30): so i guess main() is fully done, just find out if your threads are still alive when it has "hung"
bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:30): chakie chakie_work: but it worked fine when I compiled it on Qt4.1.1
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:33): can't answer what would've changed
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:33): but i've seen that behaviour in my own apps
bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:33): so how do I make sure all threads are terminated??
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:33): the solution was to provide the theeads some way of knowing when it was time to get lost
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:33): some global thingie, a signal. something
bfb6084696e956ed7899c52b95c92fd2 (17:34): I think I can try that...
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:34): but please verify first that the threads are indeed alive before redesigning
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (17:36): 'Mnabil' pasted "qt error": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1261
859620093d0762d05b35bb8fb2d9dcb7 (17:36): http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1261 THE ERROR
859620093d0762d05b35bb8fb2d9dcb7 (17:37): chakie_work, much error
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:38): install libxext-dev
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:38): use your own nick when pasting...
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:39): or perhaps qtnode is b0rken?
859620093d0762d05b35bb8fb2d9dcb7 (17:39): chakie, qtnode terminated ?!
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:40): nevermind :)
145fa9389c89c71966fe2a9787b734d7 (17:41): I can't work out how to get qt to build qdbus
145fa9389c89c71966fe2a9787b734d7 (17:41): i did add -qdbus  to the configure options
145fa9389c89c71966fe2a9787b734d7 (17:41): but it doesn't seem to have compiled it
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:42): do you have the dbus development stuff?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:42): hm, but that should have given you a compilation error...
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:42): you don't have some lib like libQtDBus or similar where the other libs are?
145fa9389c89c71966fe2a9787b734d7 (17:45): The QtDBus module cannot be enabled because libdbus-1 version 0.62 was not found.
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:46): well, that's it then :)
145fa9389c89c71966fe2a9787b734d7 (17:49): i have 0.92 installed from source
145fa9389c89c71966fe2a9787b734d7 (17:49): that should be enough, no?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:49): dunno
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:49): check the configure script (if that's what gave the error)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:50): maybe dbus is really crappy when it comes to source compatibility between versions?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (17:52): and the trolls had to pick some version
9580e9c04038137be1f333b81b06c6ca (18:05): If I develop an application using Qt3 (linux), can I run it in windows, or is that only possible with Qt4?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:07): you can run on windows, but that requires a commercial license of qt
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:07): ie you can't compile on windows without that license
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:07): so use qt4
88b5a894ccb0fe8a81262d8b1ecc36ce (18:07): there is Qt 4 opensource
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:07): it's over a year old already
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:08): gemidjy: he/she did know about qt4, i think
88b5a894ccb0fe8a81262d8b1ecc36ce (18:08): there is free pdf book afaik for qt 4
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:08): i see no reason to go with qt3 for new apps
9580e9c04038137be1f333b81b06c6ca (18:09): yea but install pyqt4 is nothing but trouble on ubuntu
9580e9c04038137be1f333b81b06c6ca (18:09): or i have to get everything from source and i'm not even sure what exactly
88b5a894ccb0fe8a81262d8b1ecc36ce (18:09): had no experience with pyqt
cea7f9481ddc3847e246edf46eb3cd05 (18:10): If you buy the old Qt book you get an open source compatible (QPL) version of Qt 3 for windows
88b5a894ccb0fe8a81262d8b1ecc36ce (18:10): non commercial
cea7f9481ddc3847e246edf46eb3cd05 (18:10): that is what I meant...
cea7f9481ddc3847e246edf46eb3cd05 (18:11): The book is "C++ GUI Programming with Qt 3", ISBN: 0131240722
9580e9c04038137be1f333b81b06c6ca (18:12): i'd rather get pyqt4 working..
9580e9c04038137be1f333b81b06c6ca (18:13): if i compile pyqt4 from source, will that keep my pyqt3 installation intact?
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:16): i think so
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (18:16): i have them both installed and use both daily

7f1f8018ee6238f734df7d2512166a52 (18:52): Yeah, in the LIBS
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (18:52): Oops, left my home computer connected.

8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (18:55): I have an interesting project he's getting started on at home... Going to see if I can get CrystalSpace and Qt4 to play nice together. It should be fairly simple to integrate their event loops...
5a39c7d82b14449a0e64d7232d073877 (18:59): in a treeview, can I make a delegate that spans several columns? or do I have to do custom drawing in each column that depend on each other?
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:01): You know, I'm really not sure... but note that custom drawing in QTreeView is by row, not by cell, so it would work out that way if you have to.
5a39c7d82b14449a0e64d7232d073877 (19:06): yeah, what I really want to do is something like what Skype for osx is doing. when a entry in teh list is clicked it expands and shows aditional information.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:07): Screenshot?
5a39c7d82b14449a0e64d7232d073877 (19:09): http://exodus.xmms.se/~tru/skype.png
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (19:10): probably a custom widget?
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:10): Oh, something like that?
5a39c7d82b14449a0e64d7232d073877 (19:10): I guess I could do a own treeview. but I wanted to avoid remimplementing it all.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:11): tru: That's not a treeview.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:11): tru: Each line there is a widget that, when it has the focus, has some children that it makes visible.
5a39c7d82b14449a0e64d7232d073877 (19:11): no, but in  my app I use a treeview because it's better then listview :)
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:12): But if you want to use a QTreeView, you could do it with custom painting.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:12): Or actually
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:12): You know, that could be implemented with a single-column tree view.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:12): Lots of delegates there.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:13): Hmm, no, better yet...
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:14): The icon is just the Qt::DecorationRole. The normal lines can be implemented without delegates.
8d2ea6eb8dbec7745e5f928afd3f874e (19:14): And it's all still a one-column treeview.
5a39c7d82b14449a0e64d7232d073877 (19:23): Yeah, you could probably insert a row temporary under the marked entry with a custom delegate.
